intro: Barthantherum, commonly known as the false brome, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. These plants typically have slender, grass-like leaves and produce small, spike-like inflorescences. They are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides. Barthantherum species are generally herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial depending on the species.
